oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Assembling a ramp
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: African American men shown on either side of chute or ramp leading into a warehouse, perhaps waiting for products which will be sent down the trough. This building was probably a general store. Men in the background observe.

"Roustabouts" was the name given to the men who handled freight on the commercial steamboats that plied Southern rivers after the Civil War. Many worked at the river landings where the boats made stops.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Earl S. Miers River Photograph Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Laborers; African Americans; City & town life; Inclined planes; General stores
